metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1429 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
Lintian before 2.5.12 allows remote attackers to gather information about the "host" system using crafted symlinks.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1429` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lintian - 2.5.11ubuntu13
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Since packages can contain arbitrary owners of files, I don't believe the symlink-restriction provides protection here

criterions.comment: lintian package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.11ubuntu13').
